attributes.action: To fund free bus travel for all ESA, JSA and Universal Credit claimants
attributes.background: Gov are transitioning ESA claimants ETC to UC, I live 12ml circular trip to nearest job centre,CAB and cheaper shops. I have back and joint problems and aged nr 49. I live in a village with only 1 bus service which wont always cover where i need to go, I am trying to save £550 for transition period.
attributes.additional_details: It costs nr £19.00 a weekly pass local the one that allows access to stage coach bus is nr £31.00. I'm concerned If my health is bad and  already struggle with shopping. How we are supposed to fund this on no income. I live on own don't drive. Im concerned many will be in this position. It also would mean that jobseeker's are covered for appointments part time work etc meaning work would pay and they wouldn't lose out re travel costs. and would help nhs patients access treatments and physio.

attributes.action: Stop the Loan Charge 2019 from being applied retrospectively
attributes.background: The 2019 Loan Charge seeks to historically tax a significant proportion of UK freelance workers for employment arrangements they used over the last twenty years. This is estimated to affect around 100,000 workers across all sectors.
attributes.additional_details:
20 years of Government inaction has meant they need a scapegoat. And the scapegoat in this instance is not only your big money footballers and celebrities but your average Joe contractor. A contractor working for 5 years on a salary of £30,000 could be liable for a sum of around £40,000.

It would be unsurprising if Freelancers as a result are pushed into family breakdown, depression and sadly even suicide. Monies that have been saved for years will be wiped out overnight.

attributes.action: Make it legal requirement to publish carbohydrate values of food in restaurants
attributes.background:
Over 4 million people in the UK have Diabetes.
In order to give the correct dose of Insulin with a meal, it's imperative to have accurate carbohydrate values available.
Without this, a diabetic is forced to guess and could either under/over medicate which can cause life threatening complications!

attributes.action: Mandatory training in ALL aspects of Domestic abuse for Family courts & Cafcass.
attributes.background:
Judiciary, Cafcass & Family court to be fully trained in domestic abuse, gas lighting, coercive control, stalking, sexual abuse, financial abuse, emotional abuse, harassment and its effects on the Family. 
70-90% of Family court & Cafcass cases involve DA.
Training would enable informed decisions
attributes.additional_details:
Daily decisions are made on recommendations by Cafcass for contact with perpetrators enforced by courts affecting families.

15 children were murdered in 2015 during contact that was enforced.

Training is essential for the safeguarding of all children and survivors.

http://safelives.org.uk/sites/default/files/resources/SafeLives%20Annual%20Impact%20Report%202016-17_web.pdf

https://www.naccc.org.uk/downloads/NewsItems/APPG_Inquiry_report_Domestic_Abuse_Child_Contact_and_the_Family_Court.pdf

attributes.action: Abolish the house of lords.
attributes.background:
The unelected house of lords are going against the will of the British people. 17.4 million voters want a brexit consisting of leaving the single market & leaving the customs union.
The house of lords wish to block this therefore they must be abolished.

attributes.action: Provide Medway funding to build Abbey court special needs secondary school
attributes.background: Abbey court is the only school in medway which caters for profoundly disabled children.There is not enough places at the secondary school due to it being to small and not purpose built for disabled children. We are calling on the government to help fund the build of a secondary school
attributes.additional_details: Abbey court primary moved to a new site in 2017. Medway ran out of money to build the secondary site(land and permission to build is there).Medway stipulated that abbey court primary has to take on ex amount of extra pupils per year, which had now caused there not to be enough secondary spaces therefor our children will be sent out of borough or placed in residential school miles away from loved ones or pulled out of the education system. Every child has a right to education disabled or not

attributes.action: Invoke the Parliament Act if the Lords reject the EU (Withdrawal) Bill
attributes.background: Brexit is democratically mandated by the referendum and manifestos of parties in Government. If the Lords reject the EU (Withdrawal) Bill, the Government must prorogue Parliament immediately and work quickly to meet the conditions to use the Parliament Acts so that the Bill can receive Royal Assent.
attributes.additional_details: The Parliament Acts assert the supremacy of the House of Commons over the House of Lords. Section 2 allows the EU (Withdrawal) Bill to be presented for Royal Assent by the Commons provided certain conditions are met. We voted to Leave the EU to restore sovereignty to the British people, for freedom and self-determination. We voted for a clean break. Lets begin this new chapter in our history by honouring the wishes of our people. Facebook.com/Brexiteers

attributes.action: Make St Georges Day a Bank Holiday in England.
attributes.background:
A nation’s patron Saint should be celebrated. 

England is one of a very select few who do not hold the privilege of being granted their National Patron Saints day off work as a Bank Holiday.

attributes.action: UK to raise the state pension to the OECD figure of 63% of average earnings.
attributes.background:
The OECD reports that the UK has the lowest state pension of any OECD country. 
This is a disgrace.
I ask for a full parliamentary debate on the issue.
UK workers retire on about 29% of average earnings, the average OECD figure is 63%.
All developed EU countries pay their pensioners more.
attributes.additional_details:
A political consensus was reached by EU Nations at the Laeken Summit in 2001, that each member state, would attempt to attain a Basic Pension of 40% of average earnings by 2007 and then work towards 60%.
In 2017 the UK state pension was £7,440.
France £15,811.
Germany £26,366.
Spain £26,630.
By 2050 Germany and Spain plan devoting 16% of GDP to Basic State Pensions. 
The UK looks likely to be still devoting only 4% of GDP. 
UK politicians should not ignore such massive pension differences.

attributes.action: Lower the retirement age for frontline road and call takers ambulance staff
attributes.background: 65 is the retirement age for ambulance staff. This type of work is too much at this age. Carrying patients, 12 hour shifts, night shifts and the type of jobs we see. We have a high mortality rate. We need to be brought in line with fire staff and police staff.
attributes.additional_details: There is evidence that ambulance staff have a mortality rate of 2 years post retirement. At a time when our staff should be relaxing after caring so much for so many years many are being taken from us too early. Reduce the retirement age

attributes.action: Declare a Climate Emergency, end fossil fuel use and build community resilience.
attributes.background: The current wave of extreme weather around the globe and in Britain indicates that the climate emergency predicted by our scientists is now here.  We must prepare for community resilience in the face of climate impacts and take urgent steps to limit warming and reverse temperatures to 1980s levels.

attributes.action: Scrap the cap on international doctors being allowed to work in the NHS
attributes.background: We call for the removal of visa restrictions preventing international doctors from working in the UK. Since Dec 2017 over 1500 visa applications from doctors who have secured NHS jobs have been refused. Meanwhile 100s of posts are vacant, waiting times are rising and patient safety is under threat.
attributes.additional_details:
Denying doctors who have secured jobs in the NHS from entering the UK does not make sense. Hospitals are wasting money on recruitment and are being forced to cover shifts with locum doctors - if they can find them. 
Gaps in rotas mean doctors are juggling large numbers of patients and stress among the profession is rising.  
International doctors are ready to work in the NHS. Scrap the cap and let them take up their posts. 
https://www.bmj.com/scrap-the-cap

attributes.action: Kids with allergies must have a right to eat safe food from home at eateries.
attributes.background: We were recently humiliated and almost refused service when we brought home made food for our son, who has life threatening allergies, to a play centre. We believe that this is a form of discrimination. Parents should have the right to provide safe food for their children without being shamed.
attributes.additional_details: Since my experience, I have discovered many other similar stories where parents are publicly shamed. We are an invisible group who are discriminated against but have no protection under the law. We would like to enjoy going out as a family knowing that our children are safe.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all new homes in England and Wales to have solar panels
attributes.background: Solar panels reduce bills by allowing homes to generate some of their own electricity. Installing solar during construction can reduce costs by over a third and with storage they can halve electricity bills. Despite this, there is no meaningful regulation forcing house builders to install solar.
attributes.additional_details:
- The Government aims to build 300,000 new homes per year yet only 8,400 homes a year install solar [BEIS/HMTreasury]
- 400,000 people in Britain are in fuel poverty [Citizens Advice]
- The MyGridGB home with solar and battery storage has half the energy bill and carbon emissions of an average UK house. Over 65% of it's electricity comes from renewables [MyGridGB.co.uk] 
- Scotland already has a scheme to encourage solar on new build homes.
- The average solar install costs less than £4,500

attributes.action: Urgent law to extend voting rights to British abroad by repealing 15-year rule.
attributes.background: Pass Bill to benefit overseas electors before any further EU vote or general election. 2022 will be too late. Hundreds and thousands of British citizens living and working abroad are disenfranchised, unable to vote on issues which affect them directly (in breach of their basic human rights).
attributes.additional_details:
Denying a vote to citizens most affected by the decision to leave the European Union was a dereliction of UK democracy. The failure of Parliament was allowing this injustice. The duty is to ensure it never happens again.
How can anyone be confident that their private life will be respected if British citizens find themselves living in EU countries with no clear status and without the protection of the Citizens Directive 2004/38 and all EU acquis (body of EU law) that protects citizens?

attributes.action: An Independent Commission into the Home Office and the "hostile environment"
attributes.background:
The Windrush Scandal and Amber Rudd’s resignation have shown the chaotic and cruel way the Home Office operates.
 
This crisis was caused by Theresa May’s “hostile environment” policy. The policy ruins lives, puts people at risk of destitution and removal, and increases the risk of modern slavery.
attributes.additional_details:
It asks landlords and doctors to act as border guards and there is no evidence that the policy works.

Migrants and those who look or sound 'foreign' are at most risk. 

We can no longer trust that the Home Office can function effectively and fairly.

We need an Independent Commission to look into the behaviour of the Home Office and its “hostile environment”. It is the only way to ensure that all those caught up in Theresa May’s “hostile environment” are protected.

attributes.action: Make the Early Years Teacher Status on par with the Qualified Teacher Status
attributes.background: The EYFS (0-5 years) is a crucial part of a child's life which requires careful and considered teaching. Early Years Teacher Status is not recognised as a teaching qualification in state schools but rather an unqualified teacher and therefore impacts on both pay and job opportunities in schools.
attributes.additional_details: In order to gain Early Years Teacher Status, an individual must complete a teaching portfolio which covers all 8 teaching standards alongside completing 120 days on placement in a variety of settings and 12 days in Key Stage 1 and 2. To complete all of the above and not be regarded as a teacher is demoralising to the hard graft that is put into our early years education system. The pay gap between an EYT and a QT is also shameful, emphasising the lack of respect for early years workers.

attributes.action: Put pressure on the Chinese Government over the treatment of Uyghur Muslims
attributes.background:
Reports have suggested that the chinese government has been placing Uyghur Muslims in “re-education” camps, forcing them to drink alcohol and consume pork, both against the Islamic faith. 

These camps are echoes of previous ethnic cleansing and there needs to be ample pressure on China.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/china-re-education-muslims-ramadan-xinjiang-eat-pork-alcohol-communist-xi-jinping-a8357966.html%3famp

attributes.action: Remove shortage occupation codes and NHS roles from Tier 2 Visa cap
attributes.background: Since December 2017, the points required to obtain a Restricted Certificate of Sponsorship (RCOS) has more than doubled - from 21 points (for nearly the entire history of the points based system) to 46 - 55 points. The months long breaching of this cap is negatively impacting NHS and business needs.
attributes.additional_details:
Removal NHS roles from the RCOS cap will allow swifter entrance for badly needed NHS staff including doctors, therapists, and key support positions, helping to ease the growing pressures faced by the service. 

Additionally, removal of the shortage occupation codes will allow businesses to more fairly compete for international talent. 

See below:

http://www.bbc.com/news/health-43898969 

https://www.peoplemanagement.co.uk/news/articles/businesses-unable-recruit-overseas-visa-limit-breached

attributes.action: UK to refer Sri Lanka to ICC in March 2019
attributes.background: Refer Sri Lanka to International Criminal Court, if it continues to fail to implement its commitment made to the UNHRC Res. [A/HRC/RES/30/1] by March 2019; by agreeing to provide accountability and transitional justice.
attributes.additional_details: It has failed to implement the resolution and brazenly repudiated its commitments to the UNHRC and victims of the war, so far without consequence. In March 2018 UN Human Rights Commissioner Zeid Ra'ad Al Hussein has also explicitly expressed his frustration, having lost faith in Sri Lanka’s willingness to engineer transitional justice and has called on member states to “explore other avenues, including the application of universal jurisdiction,that could foster accountability.” the UN Deputy for Human Rights, Kate Gilmore called for the establishment of a Special Court.

attributes.action: Don't change how Parliament’s popular and successful guided tours are run
attributes.background: For 18 years, Parliament tours have been led by professional Blue Badge Guides and experienced in-house guides. The tours have won awards and Parliament is top rated on TripAdvisor. Tours generate income for Parliament. Under new proposals 200+ professionals will stop receiving work from Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The House authorities plan to replace the current qualified guides with a downsized team. In our view, the case for this change is based on inaccurate information and flawed financial analysis. MPs and Peers have declared their support for our campaign. The proposals also call for substantial investment in a plan to guide in a building facing closure for refurbishment in seven years' time. We believe that this proposal is misguided and does not represent a good use of taxpayers' money.

attributes.action: Prohibit the removal of trees/shrubs from riverbanks & in-river wildlife habitat
attributes.background: Vital wildlife habitat for protected species like otters bats & water voles is regularly destroyed plus nesting sites for birds & refuges for fish from predation.This is carried out without the threat of prosecution. Such actions must be licensed & subject to full environmental impact assessments.
attributes.additional_details: The Angling Trust has highlighted many situations where important habitat has been removed and even on occasion found evidence of the EA removing habitat that they themselves had helped to install. Landowners and the EA need clear incentives to manage riverine environments for the maximum benefit of wildlife.  Modern flood defense strategies have failed to look at the impact on river habitat removal and the wildlife that depends on it for its survival.

attributes.action: Off-Payroll: Give full rights to workers classed as ‘employed for tax purposes'
attributes.background: Newly proposed reforms to tax the self-employed – known as Off-Payroll Working - introduces rules that enable firms to classify workers as ‘employed for tax purposes’, without providing them with any employment rights. This is wholly unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
New measures in the Off-Payroll Working consultation effectively introduce a new 15% tax for self-employed workers, while enabling firms to circumvent their obligation to give employment rights to workers. This opposes the intentions of the Government’s ‘Good Work Plan’, designed to prevent unscrupulous firms forcing vulnerable workers into precarious work.
Parliament must ensure self-employed workers cannot be classed as ‘employed for tax purposes’ without receiving full employment rights.

attributes.action: Introduce a Minister for Older People in England, as they have in Wales.
attributes.background:
This role needs to be established because currently nobody is taking overall responsibility for ensuring society treats older citizens fairly.
Pensioners in England, to whom we owe a huge debt of gratitude, should be treated with the dignity, care and respect.
attributes.additional_details: For far too long, an undercurrent of inter-generational strife has been building, with the elderly being targeted to take money from in order to help younger generations. However most young people would not wish to see pensioners deprived of their rights, or left in poverty. We need someone to liaise across Government departments, such as Treasury and Health, to ensure fairness for the wellbeing of older generations.

attributes.action: Make burning or mistreating a Union Jack in public a criminal offence.
attributes.background: There is nothing more offensive to loyal British subjects than seeing protesters destroying our nation's flag. It elicits feelings of anger and revulsion and can be a precursor to violence. It is not unreasonable to expect our nation's flag to be treated with respect.

attributes.action: Allow existing Ambulance Staff Career progression without being penalised
attributes.background: The new pay deal in the NHS is detrimental to existing Ambulance staff who wish to progress with their career. This pay deal will have the effect of hampering staff development/promotion and this could lead to a skills shortage in the next few years of experienced ambulance personnel.
attributes.additional_details:
The new NHS Pay deal included 7 words which will hamper the development of ambulance staff as any existing member of staff who has a "changes of roles (including promotion)." will be forced to a new way of being paid their unsocial hours allowance which will be detrimental for certain staff and incur the loss of up to £2.5K.

We want existing Ambulance staff to be able to progress in their careers without fear of changes to their terms and conditions and to their unsocial hours pay.

attributes.action: PM to refer ERG funding to the Independent Advisor on Minister's Interests.
attributes.background: The 'European Research Group' (ERG) is a closed political group within the government that has been supported by Ministers through their expense claims. The Prime Minister is called upon to refer this to the Independent Advisor on Minister's Interests (IMAI) for investigation and action.
attributes.additional_details:
The ERG is a closed political lobby group within the government, or in other words a "non-public organisation whose objectives may in any degree conflict with government policy". 
Various (ex)Ministers have supported this group through subscriptions claimed on expenses. This is in breach of the Ministerial Code. It is understood that public funds claimed could be in the order of over £250,000. 
Only the Prime Minister can refer allegations to the IAMI - for investigation and repayment.

attributes.action: An independent study to find if driven grouse shooting is of  economic benefit.
attributes.background: Driven grouse shooting is a minority sport which seriously compromises other activities and businesses over vast stretches of northern England. We need to determine if it is driving away more jobs and enterprises than it creates, which is likely - no country outside of the UK has it.
attributes.additional_details: Driven grouse shooting has been implicated in the loss of wildlife and oportunities for wildlife tourism. The uplands it dominates could instead have fully fledged ecotourism, natural flood alleviation projects, be more fire resistant, have woodlot forestry to provide fuel for those without mains gas, provide cleaner water and better fishing and be considerably better for general tourism. http://water.leeds.ac.uk/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/EMBER_2-page_exec_summary.pdf

attributes.action: Reduce the minimum income requirement for UK Family Visas.
attributes.background: Since 2012 it has been required that a UK Citizen must be earning a minimum of £18,600 per year before their non-EU spouse can apply to live with them in the UK. This has resulted in thousands of UK Citizens being prevented from living a normal family life in the UK with their foreign spouse.
attributes.additional_details: It is estimated that 40% of the UK population do not meet these income requirements, with women and under 30's being hit the hardest. Recent figures suggest over 13,000 families are currently separated due to these restrictions, and that 15,000 children are currently growing up separated from one of their parents. The NHS Surcharge and benefit rules already protect public funds. This means that the high income requirement is an unnecessary hurdle for families seeking to live together in the UK.

attributes.action: Get independant panel research into vaccine damage in dogs and review protocol.
attributes.background:
Lepto vaccines are believed to be responsible for the serious illnesse/ death of dogs.
Major et al. (2014) investigated an outbreak of Lepto in Bern Switzerland.  298 dogs found with Lepto. Vaccination history was available for 251 of these dogs (84.2%) Of these 95% were fully vaccinated.
attributes.additional_details:
Distemper, Hepititis and Parvovirus are all conditions which can be tested for, a titre test would be healthier and safer than just routinely repeating the vaccine. 
Dogs can be FULLY VACCINATED AND STILL CONTRACT THESE CONDITIONS due to vaccine failure or high immunity carried by the dam. Therefore just blindly vaccinating does not work. 

We believe an independant panel will take a realistic view of the true dangers of vaccination.

attributes.action: We urge the UK Government to recognise the State of Palestine.
attributes.background: Peace in the Middle East is dependant on achieving justice for all involved and for the people of Palestine have their human rights respected and the recognition of Palestine as an independent sovereign state.
attributes.additional_details:
The unilateral decision to transfer the US Embassy to Jerusalem, in defiance of previous international agreements, has been highly provocative. 
Alon Liel, former Director-General of Israel’s Foreign Ministry ‘If Britain will recognise Palestine as a government there will be a Palestinian state’. British recognition ‘will be followed by other countries, and it can turn things around.’  
This is a finding of  the  Balfour Project drawing from a wide diversity of ethnic and political views.

attributes.action: Make bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background: Bullying can drive people to have mental health problems, to self-harm and even to suicide because we are all human.
attributes.additional_details: If someone is reported for bullying, they should have a police warning. If they continue should be arrested and imprisoned for 24hrs. If they still continue then they should do community service. We need to crack down on bullying on all levels.

attributes.action: Introduce licenses for Animal Rescue Centres
attributes.background: Rescue Centres and individuals do not currently need a local authority Pet Shop or Boarding Licence if they only receive donations. A lot are never inspected unless reported for horrific welfare conditions, many animals are suffering at the hands of unscrupulous people purely out to make money.

attributes.action: Allow all British Armed Forces personnel to have a beard if they so wish.
attributes.background: Members of the British army and airforce are required to be cleanly shaved. This is a dated rule with no relevance in modern day society.
attributes.additional_details: Those serving in the navy are allowed to grow beards. Furthermore, Prince Harry has been seen on numerous occasions including his wedding wearing military uniform and sporting a beard.

attributes.action: Statutory periodic vision screening for all drivers during their driving life
attributes.background: The UK regulations are amongst the weakest in Europe relying on self-regulation and reporting. Road safety should start with good vision and current procedures lack any medical rigour to substantiate visual fitness to drive increasing the potential for injury or death due to accidents.
attributes.additional_details:
WHO declared poor vision is one of the main risk factors for crashes.

A 2014 Brake study showed 1.5 million UK drivers have never had an eye test.

Visit www.drivingblind.org.uk to rally support.

attributes.action: Make it the law for all cats to be microchipped
attributes.background: The microchipping of dogs became UK law back in 2016. I am calling for the same protection to be given to cats. Each year hundreds of thousands of cats are injured, lost and killed on our roads, a high percentage of which are often not microchipped. Of the ones that survive, many end up in shelters

attributes.action: Adapt the education system: lower student exam anxiety whilst saving NHS funds.
attributes.background:
Statistics show growing numbers of students are developing poor mental health (MH.)The education system must be rethought to reduce the pressure placed on the young to lower students' anxiety, improving MH.
This shows the rise in students' with poor MH:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-41148704
attributes.additional_details:
What to do?
Combine teacher assessment, effort levels and academic ability in final grading, lowering students' anxiety as grades won't depend solely on exam performance.
The common misconception that exams are the be-all-and-end-all contributes to the rising stress levels of students, increasing vulnerability to mental illness. 
The financial consequences of treating such preventable illnesses adds to the strain on the NHS. 
Change the education system and enable funds to be better utilised.

attributes.action: Place Cardiac Physiologists on the National Shortage Occupational list.
attributes.background: There is at least a 30% deficit in employed Cardiac Physiologists across the UK currently. Staff who are working in the UK already and those wanting to work in the UK are being rejected via the home office. The UK is struggling to provide safe Cardiology services with this lack of staffing.
attributes.additional_details: There is at least a 30% deficit in employed Cardiac Physiologists across the UK currently. Staff who are working in the UK already- and have done for many years- and those wanting to come to work in the UK are being rejected due to the point system via the home office. This leaves ALL cardiology departments across struggling to provide a safe heart service across the UK. Placing Cardiac Physiologists back on the list will fix this issue immediately. We were removed in 2013, hence the staffing issue.

attributes.action: To widen the exemptions of the Ivory Bill: de minimis rule to be 50%
attributes.background: I am concerned that the Government are using this topic to try and destroy the bona fide antiques trade. De minimis rule: 50% for cultural objects made of ivory.
attributes.additional_details: Following the introduction of the Ivory Bill, the de minimis rule is too narrow at 10% to be a working meaningful exemption. If it is not amended by Parliament it will cause the wilful destruction of genuine antiques: a chest of drawers with ivory inlay, a chess set or even a religious icon like a Corpus Christi, making them illegal to sell and perhaps be even subsequently confiscated or destroyed.

attributes.action: All teaching staff across schools in England to have SEND mandatory training
attributes.background: Made mandatory that all teachers, HTLA’s,TA’s & support staff to undertake minimum basic training to support SEND including Autism and other conditions / behaviours which may be associated with the Autism spectrum (ADHD, PDA, ODD, dyspraxia, dyslexia) to ensure appropriate support for students
attributes.additional_details: A court has delivered a landslide ruling on a recent school exclusion case.The ruling made clear that all schools must make sure they have made appropriate adjustments to support Autistic children and those with other disabilities, before they can resort to exclusion. In order to support this further, I would like to see changes made where it is mandatory that A staff working & supporting students within schools across England, should be equipped with at least the minimal basic awareness training to support all students within SEND.

attributes.action: Revise Rule 135 to stop administrators from taking fees out of client assets
attributes.background: On the collapse of a stock-broker, this rule allows administrators to take fees out of client assets / money held in “ring-fenced” accounts. A conflict of interest arises between returning assets to clients in a timely fashion and the administrators' corporate motivation to maximise fee income.
attributes.additional_details:
Individuals have invested entire life-savings via ISAs and SIPPs under the assumption that their assets / money are ring-fenced and protected.

Revise Rule 135 of the Investment Bank Special Administration Rules (England and Wales) 2011 to preserve the sanctity of ring-fenced accounts and prevent a break-down of the trust in the UK financial system.

The FSCS, which is funded by a levy on financial institutions, must cover any and all costs incurred in returning ‘ring-fenced’ assets to clients.

attributes.action: The option for farm animal sanctuaries to replace ear tags with microchips
attributes.background: Identification ear tags on farm animals for me and many others are a constant reminder of what certain animals are bred for and where they have come from. I have a farm animal sanctuary and all of our animals will be living the rest of their lives at the sanctuary, so ear tags are not necessary.
attributes.additional_details:
Farm animals that are in a sanctuary environment, that will never be entering the food chain nor being rehomed I don't believe need to have ear tags nor slap marks or tattoos for pigs. 
I believe that ear tags are pointless in a sanctuary, they must be extremely annoying, they can get infected, tags are caught and pulled out. I understand the government want a tractability system in place but microchipping will allow all the information that is needed to be on the microchip.

attributes.action: Provide funds to reopen main road (A422) between Banbury and Brackley
attributes.background: The main A road (A422) between Banbury and Brackley is closed to traffic after a bridge was deemed structurally unsafe. Bankrupt Northamptonshire County Council have no money to repair the bridge. We want central Government to step in and reopen the A422.
attributes.additional_details:
The A422 between Banbury and Brackley is an important access route between local towns, villages, jobs, schools and services, between the M1, A43 and M40. Diverted traffic is using unsuitable single track roads and roads through villages adding time, costs and danger. 

Bankrupt Northamptonshire County Council have no money to repair Farthinghoe bridge. We want central Government to step in and provide funds to reopen the A422.

attributes.action: Serious injury by dangerous driving should carry a minimum of 5 years in prison!
attributes.background: My nephew was an unfortunate casualty of this. He was 2 at the time when a careless, selfish driver thought it is more important to use his phone whilst driving. He ran a red light at knocked out my dad and nephew. The result, my nephew being severely brain damaged and now needed 24 hour care!
attributes.additional_details:
The driver pleaded guilty to the offence and then further found guilty of using his phone. The sentence given - 2 year suspended sentence for each count (2 counts). The boy full of life will never live a normal life, the family will never have their once happy, full of life, playful son! 
The driver has got off with a slap on the wrist and will live a normal life, whereas the boy and his family will live with a life sentence! 
The sentence should change and carry a minimum of 5 years in prison!

attributes.action: Make ocrelizumab available on the NHS for multiple sclerosis patients
attributes.background: Ocrelizumab is the first treatment for primary progressive MS sufferers and it's been classed a game changer for relapsing remitting MS. More than 100,000 people suffer with this horrific disease in the U.K, it's a daily struggle living with a range of complexed symptoms.

attributes.action: Make up-skirt photography an illegal offence in the UK
attributes.background: Upskirting is the act of taking a photograph of underneath a person's skirt without their consent. It is often performed in a public place such as on public transport or on an escalator. Many women across the UK are targeted in places such as nightclubs, restaurants and shops. This needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details: In Scotland, Upskirting is an illegal offence, and has been since 2010. Victims and police are only able to pursue offences of voyeurism and indecency, with a Freedom of Information request made by the Press Association revealing that the police have pursued 78 offences related to upskirting since 2015 - but only 11 led to alleged offenders being charged.

attributes.action: Make lymph sparing liposuction for lipedema available on the NHS
attributes.background: Lipedema/lipoedema is a fat disorder- affecting around 11% of the female population.  While some ladies are able to get the needed treatment (postcode lottery anyone?), the majority are left out in the cold by the NHS.  The condition is painful and progressive, and these ladies need help.
attributes.additional_details:
Lipedema is quite unknown, and the only known treatment to reduce the fatty build up, is lymph sparing liposuction.  The NHS states this (https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/lipoedema/) but class treatment as cosmetic. 

Untreated, lipedema can then progress and become lipo-lymphema - lymphedema is currently treated with liposuction under the NHS.  Ladies should not have to progress to this stage before they're offered treatment!

Please help us get the treatment we need.

http://www.lipoedema.co.uk/

attributes.action: Conduct a full enquiry into the finacial failure of NCC and those responsible
attributes.background:
Northamptonshire county council have completely failed in their financial responsibilities.
 We would like a full transparent public enquiry into the failings who is responsible and why and how this happened, so it can prevented in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
With planned cuts likely to affect the vulnerable, we think everyone involved should be held responsible and those affected have clear answers as to how this happened.
What messures are the government going to take to provide basic human rights to those most likely to be affected?

attributes.action: Ban hatching projects in schools
attributes.background: In these projects lots of the chicks become sick/deformed because their needs are not met during incubation or after hatching Their organs can stick to the sides of shells because the eggs are often not rotated properly Once over most of the chicks mainly males end up back in factory farming system
attributes.additional_details: It is important for children to learn about animals but if the way they are taught harms animals then something has gone  very wrong after the project has finished a high amount of the chicks are killed/ disposed of at poultry markets or fed to reptiles the lesson this kind of project teaches children is neither educational or compassionate since they often cause animals to suffer and treat living beings as disposable comodities the next generation deserve better than these misguided lessons

attributes.action: Train Education Workers on School Refusal (condition) & Stop Attendance Fines
attributes.background: Education employees are actioning poor attendance through the penalty system as they don’t see School Refusal as a Mental Health issue. We would like to see staff, trained to recognise & act  accordingly as mental health is not a punishable condition
attributes.additional_details: School Refusal Support Services was set up to help & support families enduring this crisis in their child’s everyday life.Staff are misinterpreting what they see & instead see the child as a truant.Staff need to understand & be trained in the differences, have the skills to support families, recognise the child's needs, work with families to move forward & not apply fines.There is a plethora of feedback from parents to suggest that  un/diagnosed spectrum conditions underpin School Refusal.
